content: Tom Lue, VP of Frontier AI Global Affairs at Google DeepMind, oversees legal, public policy, and frontier AI safety & governance teams.
Tom Lue previously served as General Counsel & Head of Governance at DeepMind, Deputy General Counsel at Waymo, and Senior Counsel at Google, advising on AI law and policy.
Tom Lue served as Acting & Deputy General Counsel at the Office of Management and Budget (OMB), leading the legal team and advising the White House and executive agencies.
Tom Lue served as Attorney-Advisor at the DOJ Office of Legal Counsel (OLC), focusing on national security and emerging technology matters.
Tom Lue taught at Stanford on law and technology and served as Chair of the Nominating and Governance Committee for the Board of iCivics, a leading civics education non-profit.
Tom Lue clerked for Justice Sonia Sotomayor on the U.S. Supreme Court and is a member of the American Law Institute.
Dr. Ayesha Khanna is a globally recognized AI expert, entrepreneur, and CEO of Addo, an AI engineering firm.
Dr. Khanna advises Fortune 500 CEOs and serves on global public and private boards and Singapore government agencies.
